description.overview: Focus represents your ability to concentrate, stay on task, and direct your attention without distraction.
description.detailed: This meter monitors how Saturn and Mars transits interact with your natal Mercury, showing your capacity for sustained concentration and mental discipline. Saturn brings structure and focus but can feel restrictive. Mars adds mental drive and urgency but can create restlessness. The 6th house (work routines) and 8th house (deep concentration) are tracked. When these planets form supportive aspects, you can concentrate deeply and work productively. Challenging aspects scatter attention or create mental resistance to focused work.

primary_planets.saturn: Mental discipline, structure, and sustained concentration
primary_planets.mars: Mental drive and urgency - can help or hinder focus

secondary_planets.mercury: Base cognitive function affecting ability to concentrate

key_houses.6: Work routines and sustained attention to daily tasks

aspect_weights.conjunction: Maximum focus impact - intense concentration or distraction
aspect_weights.opposition: High impact - mental pull between competing priorities
aspect_weights.sextile: Moderate flow - supportive for sustained work

interpretation_guidelines.tone: Practical and work-focused - talk about productivity and task management
interpretation_guidelines.focus_when_high: Emphasize tackling complex projects, deep work sessions, tasks requiring sustained attention
interpretation_guidelines.focus_when_low: Emphasize breaking tasks into smaller chunks, using timers, accepting limitations
interpretation_guidelines.focus_when_challenging: Acknowledge distractions but offer practical strategies (remove distractions, Pomodoro technique, work in bursts)
avoid: Suggesting willpower alone will fix it

phrasing_examples.high_harmonious: Your concentration is peak today - this is your window for deep work on complex projects that require sustained focus.
phrasing_examples.moderate_mixed: Focus comes with effort today - use timers, take breaks, and tackle one thing at a time rather than multitasking.
phrasing_examples.low_challenging: Concentration is genuinely hard today - break tasks into 15-minute chunks and work with your scattered attention rather than fighting it.
